string.value: Deep in the #m222010002# of the Black Mountain, I heard #p2071010# is concerned about something. I better go check it out myself.

I met #b#p2071010##k, who was heavily sighing at #m222010002# with a big lump on his head. Apparently, he got hurt from a random axe that was thrown on his way. After throwing the axe out of the pond in disgust, the owner of the axe, #b#p2071011##k, came and asked for the axe. He requested that anyone that finds the #b#t4031315##k return it to #p2071011#.\nThe Mountain God believes that the steel axe for the tree cutter might be taken by a monster, and that he has offered to look into the axe and see if it's legit. The axes will be available through #rDark Axe Stumps#k, and he'll look into it and see if it's really #b#t4031315##k.
Through the request from #p2071010#, who I met at #m222010002# of the Black Mountain, I returned #t4031315# to its rightful owner, and received the storybook on 'The Story of the Axes'.
아야야... 이거 참 산신령 체면이 말이아니군.\r\n#L0# #b어쩌다가 머리에 혹이 생기셨어요?
몇 일 전에 연못 속으로 떨어진 도끼에 머리를 부딪히고 말았네. 너무 화가 나서 도끼를 다시 연못 밖으로 집어 던져버렸지. 그런데 조금 전에 한 나뭇꾼이 와서 자신이 잃어버린 도끼를 내놓으라고 큰 소리를 치지 뭔가. 어찌나 고집불통이던지 내가 금도끼랑 은도끼를 준다고 해도 싫다더군.\r\n#L0# #b그래서 어떻게 하기로 하셨어요?
잃어버린 도끼를 내가 찾아주기로 약속했는데 아무리 찾아봐도 없어. 요즘 이 근처에 도끼를 머리에 꽂고 다니는 몬스터들이 있던데, 혹시 그 놈들 중 한 마리가 가져간게 아닐까? 자네 날 좀 도와주지 않겠나?
Ouch... This is not the way the #p2071010# works.\r\n#L0# #bHow did you end up with that lump on your head?

A few days ago, I got hit on the head by an axe that was dropped inside the pond. I was so incensed by this unruly behavior that I threw it back out. Just now, some tree cutter came by and demanded that I return his lost axe, though. He was so adamant about his axe that he didn't want the gold axe or the silver axe that I offered in place of it.\r\n#L0# #bSo what do you plan on doing with it?

I promised to find the lost axe a while ago, but no matter how much I try, I can't find it. Nowadays, there seems to be monsters that have the axe stuck on their forehead. I wonder if one of them took his axe... can you please help me out on this?

Please find the #btree cutter's steel axe#k that has been thrown out of the pond and return it to the tree cutter. I think a monster might have snatched it away. Bring the #baxe#k that the #rDark Stump#k yields, and I'll try to determine if the axe is indeed from the cutter or not.
For you to say no to #p2071010#'s request ... my gosh, the lump on my head seems to be getting bigger and bigger now...
Hey, that axe you have in your hand ... it looks awfully familiar. It looks like the one I lost! Can I take a look at it?

Yes! This is the axe that I lost! I was working, and all of a sudden, it slipped out of my hand and fell into the pond. Too bad the God of Mountain decided to throw it back out somewhere remote. I returned home with a promise that he'll someday find it for me, but that really wasn't enough to comfort me... anyway, thank you so much for your work.

Here, take it. It's a book that I've had for a long time, but I really don't have time to read books these days, so it's been doing nothing but collecting dust. I want to give this to you in return for bringing back the axe!
I haven't been able to concentrate on work with my axe gone. I'm so glad I got it back!
If you happened to find the steel axe that belongs to the tree cutter, please return it to him.
Where did my axe go? I can't work without the axe that my hand has grown accustomed to...
